main event: A bright light was observed hovering in the sky in Toledo, Ohio, with the observation lasting approximately 5 minutes on March 25, 1966.
interesting points: The light was described as a brilliant white and appeared to be crescent-shaped, resembling the moon despite the moon not being visible at the time., The observer estimated the size of the object to be about six times that of a match head held at arm's length., The object was stationary and emitted no noise during the observation., The conclusion drawn from the sighting was that the object was likely the moon, given its characteristics., The report notes that there were no corroborating photographs or physical evidence attached to the sighting.
